tool_description: Celitech Bee API enables web and mobile apps to add cellular data eSIM to their online offerings.
name: Celitech Bee - Wireless eSIM
title: Celitech Bee - Wireless eSIM

api_list.name: Check remaining balance
api_list.description: Use this call with a purchase_Id (e.g. 4973fa15-6979-4daa-9cf3-672620df819c) to check the remaining balance (in Megabytes) of any purchase.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://celitech-bee-wireless-esim.p.rapidapi.com/purchases/purchase_id/consumption"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "celitech-bee-wireless-esim.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://celitech-bee-wireless-esim.p.rapidapi.com/purchases/{purchase_id}/consumption"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "celitech-bee-wireless-esim.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: eSIM status & manual activation
api_list.description:
Use this call with eSIM's ICCID to check the eSIM status, whether it is installed, activated, or deleted.
This call also returns the manual activation code of an eSIM (e.g. LPA:1$RSP-1012.XXXXXXXX.NET$AAAAA-BBBBB-CCCCC-DDDDD) in case the end-user prefers to use eSIM manual activation instead of QR.

api_list.name: Get destinations
api_list.description: Use this call to get the countries and regions supported by the API.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://celitech-bee-wireless-esim.p.rapidapi.com/destinations"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "celitech-bee-wireless-esim.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get packages
api_list.description: Use this call to get the cellular data packages (by size, period, and country) supported by the API. Any package size or period can be created to match any use case. Packages are identified by unique package_Id.
